alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Ladson, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Airport, Don Holt Bridge, Delemar Crossroads, Cainhoy, Wando, Archdale and Middleton Place.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
